The exclusive range is being manufactured to welcome Marathon to the market, and the announcement comes at the same time as the game‚Äôs release date was confirmed.

The full game will be released on March 5, but for now, you can stoke your excitement by preparing to preorder the limited edition controller and headset.

item.title: Is Heartopia on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Or Switch? All Console Platforms, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Heartopia will likely end 2026 as one of the most lovingly titled games, and the life-sim title established itself early on as a game to keep an eye on. Its popularity boomed very quickly, and if you PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo owners want in on the action, there are answers for you all.

You‚Äôd think you can only have so many life-sim games like Heartopia. Yet, the game from developer XD is proving once again that humanity can‚Äôt get enough of building houses and completing menial tasks that would be more productive if done in the real world‚Äîbut we‚Äôre all gamers here, it would be hypocritical to suggest you go touch grass.

If you have a Heartopia-shaped box on your mind, its console status should be of interest.

Can You Play Heartopia On PlayStation 5?

It‚Äôs an arrow through the heart for PS5 users as Heartopia isn‚Äôt available to play on PlayStation consoles at launch.

Heartopia‚Äôs launch day player numbers on PC were fantastic, as were the ones after it! Before it came to Steam, Heartopia actually launched on the Google Play Store and the App Store. It garnered a reputation very first, making its Steam release a popular one. Tens of thousands of people got straight to work on creating homes and virtual lives.

For now, PlayStation 5 owners must miss out and play the waiting game.

Can You Play Heartopia On Xbox Series X|S?

Heartopia is bypassing Xbox consoles, leaving Xbox Series X|S users to have their hearts skip a beat.

Everyone is striking out with Heartopia. The life-sim title doesn‚Äôt have any love in its heart for Microsoft and Xbox owners right now. It follows the same sorrowful fate as PlayStation players, but let‚Äôs hope there‚Äôs a future where this can change.

Can You Play Heartopia On Nintendo Switch or Switch 2?

Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 owners can also get in the same loveless boat, as Heartopia isn‚Äôt on a Nintendo console either.

Per the Heartopia Discord Server, one of its main moderators (sweetkayla_xo) said:

‚ÄúNo ‚Äì Heartopia isn‚Äôt launching on consoles yet.‚Äù

It‚Äôs unclear how much official information they have on the game. If they do know the inner-workings of the game‚Äôs development and reach, then this is a surefire sign that Heartopia is coming to consoles; we just don‚Äôt know when.

Are you playing Heartopia on mobile or PC? Do you have anything to say about the poor console players who are missing out? You can share your thoughts via the official Insider Gaming Discord Server.

item.title: Stellar Blade 2 Location Tease Points To Post-Apocalyptic China
item.content:encoded:
Shift Up recently posted an image on social media revealing a ‚Äòlocation scout‚Äô for their ‚Äònext title‚Äô, which is almost certainly Stellar Blade 2. The follow-up to the 2024 post-apocalyptic sultry slasher was confirmed a while back, and by now, it should be full steam ahead for Shift Up in terms of piecing it together.

The apocalyptic landscape shared by the team on social media is a snippet taken from Chongqing, China. This is a gargantuan, dense cityscape with a population of over 32 million people, but in Stellar Blade 2, it appears as a ghost city.

Stellar Blade 2 Promises to Turn Heads

Stellar Blade dropped on PlayStation 5 in 2024, emerging as a game that intrigued players because, while it was marketed almost as a ‚Äògooner game‚Äô, it turned out to have some immensely satisfying combat mechanics and a decent story.

The game‚Äôs lead, Eve, wastes no time in showing as much flesh as possible, and that‚Äôs why the game perhaps didn‚Äôt get as serious a stamp of approval as it should have from some critics.

Regardless, it was a commercial success that was compounded by a hugely successful launch on PC a year later, and recently, the team at Shift Up revealed that another game in the series is coming.

The recent post on social media shows a crumbling, abandoned landscape, which eagle-eyed fans immediately identified as being a rendition of Chongqing, China. This was confirmed by Shift Up shortly after, giving fans the impression that, whenever Stellar Blade 2 arrives, it might take inspiration from or be directly set in and around the Chinese city.

It‚Äôs no big secret that Chinese fans were hugely approving of the game. It was estimated that 58% of PC-related sales of Stellar Blade were from China.

We know nothing about Stellar Blade 2, outside of these tiny tidbits from Shift Up. The nature of the game is yet to be revealed, but it might not be too long before it is. Fans expect something to be uncovered in the coming months.

What are you expecting to see from Stellar Blade 2? Let us know your thoughts on the Insider Gaming Discord server.
